meanings.definition: Shine brightly, especially with a sparkling light.
meanings.sent1: The stars glistered in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The sun made the water glister like diamonds.
meanings.sent3: Her smile seemed to glister with joy.
meanings.sent4: The city glistered with holiday decorations.
meanings.sent5: The dew on the grass glistered in the morning light.

meanings.sent1: The glister of the crystal caught her eye.
meanings.sent2: The glister of the snow made the landscape magical.
meanings.sent3: The glister of the disco ball added fun to the party.
meanings.sent4: The glister of the ocean under the moonlight was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The glister of the stars in the clear sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To be bright and showy, often with a superficial attractiveness.
meanings.sent1: The costume jewelry glistered under the lights.
meanings.sent2: The new car glistered in the showroom.
meanings.sent3: The cake glistered with colorful frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes glistered with unshed tears.
meanings.sent5: The city skyline glistered with neon lights at night.
